conclusion: Given: mass m, charge q, length L, angle θ.
To find electric field strength E, consider forces: gravitational, tension, electric.
Gravitational force F_g acts downward: F_g = mg.
Tension T in string has vertical and horizontal components.
Electric force F_e acts horizontally: F_e = qE.
Horizontal component of tension equals electric force, vertical component equals gravitational force.
Solving for E: E = mg tan(θ)/q.
Electric field strength E = mg tan(θ)/q.
